Chapter on the Inconceivable Dharma of the Buddha, Part 1, Chapter 33, Part 1
At that time, in the great assembly, there were bodhisattvas who had this thought:
How is it that the Buddha lands are inconceivable?ğŸ”½How is it that the fundamental vows of the buddhas are inconceivable?ğŸ”½How is it that the lineage of the buddhas is inconceivable?
How is it that the appearance of the buddhas is inconceivable?
How is it that the body of the buddhas is inconceivable?
How is it that the voice of the buddhas is inconceivable?ğŸ”½How is it that the wisdom of the buddhas is inconceivable?
How is it that the mastery of the buddhas is inconceivable?ğŸ”½How is it that the unobstructedness of the buddhas is inconceivable?
How is it that the liberation of the buddhas is inconceivable?

At that time, the World-Honored One knew the thoughts in the minds of the bodhisattvas. He then empowered them with his spiritual power, embraced them with his wisdom, illuminated them with his light, and filled them with his majestic power. He enabled the Bodhisattva Blue Lotus Treasury to abide in the Buddha's fearlessness, enter the Buddha's Dharma realm, attain the Buddha's majestic virtue and spiritual powers, and have mastery. He enabled him to have the Buddha's unobstructed and vast observation, to know the succession of all Buddhas' lineages, and to abide in the expedient means of the inexpressible Buddha Dharma.

At that time, the Bodhisattva Blue Lotus Treasury was then able to penetrate the unobstructed Dharma realm, was then able to abide in the profound practice free from hindrances, was then able to fulfill Samantabhadra's great vows, was then able to know and see all Buddha Dharmas, and with a mind of great compassion observed sentient beings, wishing to purify them and diligently cultivate without weariness. He accepted and practiced all bodhisattva Dharmas, in a single thought produced the Buddha's wisdom, understood all inexhaustible Dharma gates, and was fully endowed with dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s and eloquence;
By the Buddha's spiritual power, he addressed the Bodhisattva Lotus Treasury, saying:
Buddha's disciple!
The World-Honored Buddhas have immeasurable abodes, namely:

Always abiding in great compassion, abiding in various bodies to perform the Buddha's work, abiding in the intention of equality to turn the pure Dharma wheel, abiding in the four unobstructed abilities to expound immeasurable dharmas, abiding in the inconceivable dharmas of all Buddhas, abiding in the pure sound pervading immeasurable lands, abiding in the unspeakable and profound Dharma realm, abiding in the manifestation of the most supreme spiritual powers, and abiding in the ability to reveal the unobstructed ultimate Dharma.
Buddha's disciple!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of dharmas that universally pervade the immeasurable and boundless Dharma realm.
What are the ten?
They are:ğŸ”½All Buddhas have boundless bodies with pure physical characteristics, universally entering all realms without attachment;
All Buddhas have boundless unobstructed eyes, able to clearly see all dharmas;
All buddhas have boundless, unobstructed ears that can understand all sounds;
All buddhas have boundless noses that can reach the other shore of the buddhas' mastery;
All buddhas have broad and long tongues that emit wonderful sounds pervading the Dharma realm;
All buddhas have boundless bodies that accord with the minds of sentient beings, enabling them all to see;
All buddhas have boundless minds that abide in the unobstructed, equal Dharma body;
All buddhas have boundless unobstructed liberation, manifesting inexhaustible great supernormal powers;

All buddhas have boundless pure worlds, manifesting the buddhas' lands according to the inclinations of sentient beings, replete with immeasurable various adornments, yet not giving rise to attachment to them;
All buddhas have boundless bodhisattva practices and vows, attaining perfect wisdom, playfully mastering all buddha-dharmas.
Buddha-Son!
These are the ten kinds of Buddha Dharmas of the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, which pervade the Dharma realm without boundaries.
Buddha-Son!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of wisdom that arise moment by moment.
What are the ten?
Namely:
All Buddhas, in a single thought, are able to manifest in immeasurable worlds descending from the heavens;
All Buddhas, in a single thought, are able to manifest in immeasurable worlds the Bodhisattvas taking birth;
All Buddhas, in a single thought, are able to manifest in immeasurable worlds leaving home to study the Way;
All Buddhas, in a single thought, are able to manifest in immeasurable worlds under the Bodhi tree attaining perfect enlightenment;
All Buddhas, in a single thought, are able to manifest in immeasurable worlds turning the wonderful Dharma wheel;
All buddhas in a single thought can manifest in innumerable worlds teaching and transforming sentient beings and making offerings to buddhas;
All buddhas in a single thought can manifest in innumerable worlds the various buddha bodies beyond verbal description;
All buddhas in a single thought can manifest in innumerable worlds the various adornments, innumerable adornments, and the self-mastery of the TathÄgata, the treasury of omniscience;
All buddhas in a single thought can manifest in innumerable worlds the pure sentient beings beyond measure and number;

All buddhas in a single thought can manifest in innumerable worlds the various faculties, various endeavors, and various understandings of sentient beings in the three times, and their perfect enlightenment in the three times.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The buddhas, the world-honored ones, have ten kinds of never missing the right time.
What are the ten?
They are:
All buddhas attain perfect enlightenment without losing the right time;
All buddhas bring to maturity those with affinities without losing the right time;
All buddhas confer predictions on bodhisattvas without losing the right time;
All buddhas manifest spiritual powers in accordance with the minds of sentient beings without losing the right time;
All buddhas manifest the body of a buddha in accordance with the understanding of sentient beings without losing the right time;
All buddhas abide in great equanimity without losing the right time;
All buddhas enter into the villages without losing the right time;
All buddhas gather the pure faithful without losing the right time;
All buddhas tame evil beings without losing the right time;
All buddhas manifest inconceivable spiritual powers of the buddhas without losing the right time.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of incomparable and inconceivable realms.
What are the ten?
They are:
All buddhas, sitting cross-legged, fill the immeasurable worlds in the ten directions;
All buddhas, in a single statement, are able to expound all the Buddha's teachings;
All buddhas, emitting a single light, are able to illuminate all worlds;
All buddhas, in a single body, are able to manifest all bodies;
All buddhas, in a single place, are able to manifest all worlds;
All buddhas, in a single cognition, are able to decisively understand all dharmas without obstruction;
All buddhas, in a single thought, are able to go to all worlds in the ten directions;
All buddhas, in a single thought, universally manifest the immeasurable majestic virtue of the TathÄgata;
All buddhas, in a single thought, universally contemplate the buddhas and sentient beings of the three times without their minds being in disarray;
All buddhas, in a single thought, are the same in essence as the buddhas of the past, present, and future, without duality.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciple!
The World-Honored Buddhas are able to give rise to ten kinds of wisdom.
What are the ten?
Namely:
All Buddhas know that all dharmas have no destination, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of vows of dedication;
All Buddhas know that all dharmas are originally without body, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of pure body;
All Buddhas know that all dharmas are originally non-dual, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of enlightenment;
All Buddhas know that all dharmas are originally without self and without sentient beings, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of taming sentient beings;
All Buddhas know that all dharmas are originally without characteristics, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of discerning characteristics;
All Buddhas know that all worlds have no formation or destruction, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of discerning formation and destruction;
All Buddhas know that all dharmas have no creation, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom of knowing karmic fruits;

All buddhas know that all dharmas are inexpressible, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom that understands expressions;ğŸ”½All buddhas know that all dharmas are without defilement or purity, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom that knows defilement and purity;
All buddhas know that all dharmas are without arising or ceasing, yet they are able to give rise to the wisdom that understands arising and ceasing.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The buddhas have ten kinds of universally entering dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:
All buddhas have a pure and wondrous body that universally enters the three times;
All buddhas are all fully endowed with the three kinds of mastery, universally transforming sentient beings;
All buddhas are all fully endowed with all dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s, universally able to uphold all buddha-dharmas;
All buddhas are all fully endowed with the four kinds of eloquence, universally turning the pure Dharma wheel in all places;
All buddhas are fully endowed with impartial great compassion, never abandoning any sentient beings;
All buddhas are fully endowed with profound meditation, always universally observing all sentient beings;
All buddhas are fully endowed with the wholesome roots of benefiting others, taming sentient beings without rest;
All buddhas are fully endowed with an unobstructed mind, able to universally abide in all Dharma realms;
All buddhas are fully endowed with unobstructed spiritual powers, universally manifesting the buddhas of the three times in a single thought;
All buddhas are fully endowed with unobstructed wisdom, universally establishing the eons of the three times in a single thought.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of vast Dharmas that are difficult to believe and accept.
What are the ten?
They are:
All buddhas are able to destroy all demons;
All buddhas are able to subdue all non-Buddhists;
All buddhas are able to tame all sentient beings, making them all joyful;
All buddhas are able to go to all worlds to guide and transform beings;
All buddhas are able to realize the profound Dharma realm with wisdom;
All buddhas are able to manifest various bodies with their non-dual bodies, filling the worlds;

All buddhas are able to use their pure sounds to give rise to the four forms of fearlessness and expound the Dharma unceasingly, and those who believe and accept it will not have their efforts wasted;
All buddhas are able to manifest buddhas equal to the number of dust motes in all worlds within a single pore, without interruption;

All buddhas can manifest in a single atom as many lands as atoms in all worlds, replete with various supreme adornments, and constantly turn the wheel of the sublime Dharma to teach and transform beings in those lands, yet the atom does not expand and the worlds do not shrink, always abiding in the Dharma realm with realized wisdom.

All buddhas thoroughly understand the pure Dharma realm, and with the light of wisdom they shatter the world's ignorance, enabling all to awaken to the Buddha's teachings and follow the TathÄgata, abiding in the ten powers.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The buddhas, the world-honored ones, have ten kinds of great merits, free from faults and pure.
What are the ten?
They are:
All buddhas possess great authority, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas are born in the families of the tathÄgatas of the three times, their lineage well-bred, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas, throughout the future, have no abode in their minds, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas, in the dharmas of the three times, are unattached, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas know that various natures are one nature, coming from nowhere, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas, in the merit and virtue of the past and future, are inexhaustible, equal to the Dharma realm, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas, with boundless physical characteristics, pervade the lands in the ten directions, taming all beings according to the time, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas attain the four forms of fearlessness, free from all fear, and in the midst of the assembly they roar the great lion's roar, clearly discerning all dharmas, free from faults and pure;

All buddhas, for inexpressibly inexpressible eons, enter parinirvÄá¹‡a, and beings who hear their names attain immeasurable blessings, no different from the present merit of the buddhas, free from faults and pure;
All buddhas are far away in worlds beyond description, yet if there are beings who single-mindedly contemplate them, they will all be able to see them, free from faults and pure.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of ultimate purity.
What are the ten?
Namely:
All buddhas' vast vows from the past are ultimately pure;
All buddhas' observance of pure conduct is ultimately pure;
All buddhas' freedom from worldly afflictions is ultimately pure;
All buddhas' adornment of their lands is ultimately pure;ğŸ”½All buddhas' retinues are ultimately pure;
All buddhas' clans are ultimately pure;ğŸ”½All buddhas' physical bodies and excellent characteristics are ultimately pure;
All buddhas' Dharma bodies are ultimately pure;
All buddhas' omniscience is ultimately pure;
All buddhas have mastery over liberation, have accomplished what was to be done, have reached the other shore, and are ultimately pure.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas, in all worlds and at all times, have ten kinds of buddha activities.
What are the ten?
First, if there are sentient beings who single-mindedly recollect [the Buddha], then [the Buddha] will appear before them;
Second, if there are sentient beings whose minds are not well-disciplined, then [the Buddha] will expound the Dharma for them;
Third, if there are sentient beings who are able to give rise to pure faith, then [the Buddha] will surely enable them to attain immeasurable wholesome roots;
Fourth, if there are sentient beings who are able to enter the stage of the Dharma, then [the Buddha] will cause them all to realize [enlightenment] and there is nothing that is not understood;
Fifth, [the Buddha] teaches and transforms sentient beings without feeling tired;
Sixth, [the Buddha] travels to the buddha-lands, coming and going without obstruction;
Seventh, [the Buddha's] great compassion does not abandon any sentient beings;
Eighth, [the Buddha] manifests transformation bodies, which are always uninterrupted;
Ninth, spiritual powers are sovereign and never cease;
Tenth, abiding in the Dharma realm, able to observe everywhere.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharmas.
What are the ten?
They are:ğŸ”½The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' boundless Dharma body;
The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' immeasurable Buddha activities;
The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' eye of wisdom realm;
The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' immeasurable, innumerable, inconceivable wholesome roots;
The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' universally raining down all the sweet dew of the sublime Dharma;
The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' praising the merits of the Buddhas;ğŸ”½The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' cultivating various vows and practices in the past;
The inexhaustible wisdom ocean dharma of all Buddhas' always performing Buddha activities throughout the future;
all buddhas know the inexhaustible ocean of wisdom of the mental activities of all sentient beings;
all buddhas have inexhaustible ocean-like wisdom in the adornments of blessings and wisdom that cannot be surpassed.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of constant dharmas.
What are the ten?
They are:
All buddhas always practice all pÄramitÄs;
all buddhas are always free from confusion regarding all dharmas;
all buddhas always possess great compassion;
all buddhas always possess the ten powers;
all buddhas always turn the Dharma wheel;
all buddhas always delight in subduing all sentient beings;
all buddhas always have the correct mindfulness of the non-dual Dharma;
all buddhas always manifest entering nirvÄá¹‡a without remainder after transforming sentient beings, because the realm of the buddhas is boundless.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of explanations of the immeasurable Dharma gates of the Buddhas.
What are the ten?
They are:ğŸ”½All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the realms of sentient beings;
All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the practices of sentient beings;
All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the karmic fruits of sentient beings;ğŸ”½All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of transforming sentient beings;
All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of purifying sentient beings;ğŸ”½All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the practices of Bodhisattvas;
All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the vows of Bodhisattvas;
All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the formation and destruction of all worlds;
All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the Bodhisattvas' pure Buddha lands with their profound minds;
All Buddhas explain the immeasurable Dharma gates of the successive appearances of all Buddhas in the three times in all worlds in the various kalpas;
All buddhas expound the wisdom of all buddhas.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The buddhas have ten kinds of buddha-works for sentient beings.
What are the ten?
Namely:
All buddhas manifest physical bodies for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas emit wonderful sounds for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas accept things for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas do not accept things for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas use earth, water, fire, and wind for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas use spiritual powers and freedom to manifest all objects for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas use various names and epithets for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas use buddha-lands and realms for sentient beings as buddha-works;
All buddhas purify buddha-lands for the sake of sentient beings and perform buddha-work;
All buddhas are silent and without speech for the sake of sentient beings and perform buddha-work.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The buddhas, the world-honored ones, have ten kinds of most excellent dharmas.
What are the ten?
They are:
All buddhas have firm and unbreakable great vows. What they say must be done, and their words are without duality;
All buddhas, in order to perfect all merits, cultivate bodhisattva practices throughout future kalpas without becoming weary;
All buddhas, in order to subdue a single sentient being, go to innumerable, untold worlds, and so it is for all sentient beings without interruption;
All buddhas, with great compassion, universally observe sentient beings with faith and those without faith, viewing them equally without distinction;
All buddhas, from their initial resolve up to becoming buddhas, never regress from the resolve for enlightenment;
All buddhas accumulate immeasurable good merits and virtues, all of which they dedicate to the nature of omniscience, and they are never attached to the world.

All buddhas cultivate the three karmas in the presence of all buddhas, only practicing the buddhas' practices, not the practices of the two vehicles, all of which they dedicate to the nature of omniscience, accomplishing unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
All buddhas emit great light, that light equally illuminating everywhere, and illuminating all the buddhas' teachings, causing the bodhisattvas' minds to attain purity and fulfill omniscience.
All buddhas abandon worldly pleasures, neither greedy nor attached, and universally vow that the world may leave behind suffering and attain happiness, without any frivolous disputes.

All buddhas have compassion for sentient beings who undergo various sufferings, protecting the buddha lineage, practicing the buddhas' realm, leaving behind birth and death, and reaching the stage of the ten powers.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciple!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of unobstructed abodes.
What are the ten?
Namely:
All Buddhas can go to all worlds without obstruction;
All Buddhas can abide in all worlds without obstruction;
All Buddhas can walk, stand, sit, and lie down in all worlds without obstruction;
All Buddhas can expound the true Dharma in all worlds without obstruction;
All Buddhas can abide in the Tuá¹£ita Heaven in all worlds without obstruction;
All Buddhas can enter the Dharma realm and all the three times without obstruction;
All Buddhas can sit at all enlightenment sites in the Dharma realm without obstruction;
All Buddhas can observe the mental activities of all sentient beings in every thought and teach and tame them with the three kinds of mastery without obstruction;
All buddhas can abide with one body in the inconceivable abodes of innumerable buddhas and in all places, benefiting sentient beings without obstruction.
All buddhas can expound the true Dharma taught by innumerable buddhas without obstruction.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of supreme and unsurpassed adornments.
What are the ten?
All buddhas are fully endowed with the major and minor marks, which is the first supreme and unsurpassed bodily adornment of the buddhas.

All buddhas are fully endowed with sixty kinds of sounds, each sound having five hundred parts, each part having innumerable hundreds of thousands of pure sounds as adornments, able to expound the profound Dharma meaning of the TathÄgata with the great lion's roar in all assemblies within the Dharma realm without any fear, and all beings who hear it are delighted and are able to be tamed according to their faculties and desires. This is the second most excellent and unsurpassed adornment of speech of the buddhas.

All buddhas are fully endowed with the ten powers, the great samÄdhis, and the eighteen distinctive abilities, adorning their mental activities. The realms they practice are unobstructed, and they have attained all the buddhadharmas without exception. They are adorned by the adornments of the Dharma realm. The mental activities of beings in the Dharma realm, each with their own differences in the past, future, and present, they are all able to clearly see in a single thought. This is the third most excellent and unsurpassed adornment of mind of the buddhas.

All buddhas are able to emit innumerable lights, each light having innumerable nets of light as its retinue, universally illuminating all buddha-lands, dispelling the darkness of the world, manifesting the appearance of innumerable buddhas, their bodies equal and all pure, their buddha-work all not in vain, able to cause sentient beings to reach irreversibility. This is the fourth most supreme and unsurpassed light adornment of the buddhas.

When all buddhas manifest a smile, they all emit hundreds of thousands of myriads of koá¹­is of nayutas of incalculably many lights from their mouths, each light having innumerable inconceivable various colors, universally illuminating the worlds of the ten directions, and in the great assembly they speak true words, bestowing the prediction of anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi on innumerable and inconceivable sentient beings. This is the fifth most supreme and unsurpassed adornment of manifesting a smile free from worldly delusion of the buddhas.

All buddhas have the Dharma body, pure and unobstructed, ultimately penetrating all dharmas, abiding in the boundless Dharma realm, though in the world not mixed with the world, understanding the true nature of the world, practicing supramundane dharmas, with the path of speech cut off, transcending aggregates, realms, and sense bases. This is the sixth most excellent and unsurpassed adornment of the Dharma body of the buddhas.

All buddhas have immeasurable and eternally wondrous light, adorned with innumerable and inexpressibly various colors and forms, serving as a treasury of light, giving rise to immeasurable perfect light, universally illuminating the ten directions without obstruction. This is the seventh most excellent and unsurpassed adornment of the eternally wondrous light of the buddhas.

All buddhas have boundless wondrous forms, delightful wondrous forms, pure wondrous forms, wondrous forms that manifest according to the mind, wondrous forms that outshine the three realms, and unsurpassed wondrous forms that reach the other shore. This is the eighth most supreme and unsurpassed wondrous form adornment of the buddhas.

All buddhas are born in the lineage of buddhas of the three times, accumulating the treasures of myriad good deeds, ultimately pure, without faults or defects, free from worldly slander, adorned by the most supreme and pure practices among all dharmas, fully accomplishing omniscience, and their lineage is pure and beyond reproach. This is the ninth most supreme and unsurpassed lineage adornment of the buddhas.

All buddhas adorn their bodies with the power of great kindness, ultimately pure and free from craving, their physical actions forever at rest, their minds well liberated, and those who see them are never sated. Their great compassion rescues and protects all worlds;

The foremost field of blessings, the unsurpassed recipient, compassionately benefits all sentient beings, causing them to increase immeasurable merit and wisdom, this is the tenth supreme, unsurpassed great compassion and kindness merit adornment of the buddhas.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciples!
The buddhas have ten kinds of mastery over the Dharma.
What are the ten?
They are:ğŸ”½All buddhas have mastery over all dharmas, clearly penetrating various phrases and meanings, expounding the dharmas with unobstructed eloquence, this is the first mastery of the buddhas.

All buddhas teach and transform sentient beings without ever missing the right time, according to their aspirations they expound the true Dharma, causing them all to be tamed without interruption, this is the second mastery of the buddhas.

All buddhas can cause the immeasurable, innumerable adornments of the realm of space to shake all worlds in the six ways, causing those worlds to either rise or sink, to be either large or small, to either merge or scatter, without ever harming a single being. The beings therein are unaware, do not know, have no doubts, and are not astonished. This is the third sovereign power of the buddhas.

All buddhas, with their spiritual powers, are able to adorn and purify all worlds. In a single thought, they universally manifest the adornments of all worlds. The descriptions of these adornments would not be exhausted even in countless eons. They are all free from defilements, incomparably pure. All the adornments of the buddha-lands are equally included within a single land. This is the fourth sovereign power of the buddhas.

All buddhas, seeing a single sentient being who should receive their teaching, will remain for an ineffably ineffable number of eons, even to the end of the future, sitting cross-legged with body and mind unwearied, their minds focused in recollection without ever forgetting, skillfully taming them without missing the right time;
As they do for a single sentient being, so they do for all sentient beings. This is the fifth mastery of the buddhas.
All buddhas are able to go to all worlds and to all places where the tathÄgatas act, without ever temporarily abandoning the entire Dharma realm;

In the ten directions, each in a separate place, there are innumerable oceans of worlds, and in each ocean of worlds there are innumerable world systems. The buddhas, with their spiritual powers, reach them all in a single thought, turning the unobstructed pure Dharma wheel. This is the sixth mastery of the buddhas.

All buddhas, in order to subdue all sentient beings, moment after moment attain supreme perfect enlightenment, yet with regard to all buddha-dharmas they are neither already enlightened nor will they be enlightened, and they do not abide in the stage of learning, yet they know and see all, penetrating without obstruction, with immeasurable wisdom and immeasurable freedom, teaching and subduing all sentient beings. This is the seventh mastery of the buddhas.

All buddhas are able to use the eye faculty to perform buddha-work with the ear faculty, are able to use the ear faculty to perform buddha-work with the nose faculty, are able to use the nose faculty to perform buddha-work with the tongue faculty, are able to use the tongue faculty to perform buddha-work with the body faculty, are able to use the body faculty to perform buddha-work with the mind faculty, are able to use the mind faculty in all worlds to abide in the various realms of the world and beyond the world, and in each realm are able to perform immeasurable vast buddha-work. This is the eighth mastery of the buddhas.

All buddhas, in each and every pore of their bodies, are able to contain all sentient beings. The bodies of each and every sentient being are all equal to the inexpressibly vast buddha lands, yet there is no crowding or constraint. Each and every sentient being, with each and every step, is able to pass through innumerable worlds. In this way, they continue on for innumerable eons, seeing all the buddhas appearing in the world, teaching and transforming sentient beings, turning the pure Dharma wheel, and revealing the inexpressible Dharma of the past, future, and present.

Extending throughout the realm of space, all sentient beings of the various destinies, their physical forms, deportment, comings and goings, and the various enjoyments they experience are all completely fulfilled, yet there is no obstruction among them. This is the ninth mastery of the buddhas.

All buddhas in a single instant manifest the buddhas of as many worlds as there are atoms in all worlds. Each buddha shows the buddhas' spiritual powers in the lotus treasury lion seat in the world of vast adornment of wondrous lotuses in all Dharma realms.

Just as in the world of vast adornment of wondrous lotuses, so in all Dharma realms, in worlds of various adornments, various realms, various forms, various manifestations, and various eons, pure worlds;

Just as in a single instant, so in immeasurable, boundless, incalculable eons, in all thoughts, all manifestations in a single instant, abiding in immeasurable [worlds] for a single instant, yet never using the slightest effort. This is the tenth mastery of the buddhas.
Buddha's disciples!
The World-Honored Buddhas have ten kinds of immeasurable, inconceivable, perfect Buddha Dharmas.
What are the ten?
Namely:
All buddhas have each and every pure characteristic endowed with a hundred merits;
All buddhas have all accomplished all buddha-dharmas;
All buddhas have all accomplished all wholesome roots;
All buddhas have all accomplished all merits;
All buddhas are able to teach and transform all sentient beings;
All buddhas are all able to act as masters for sentient beings;
All buddhas have all accomplished a pure buddha land;
All buddhas have all accomplished omniscience;
All buddhas have all accomplished a physical body with excellent characteristics, such that those who see it benefit and their efforts are not wasted;
All buddhas are endowed with the equal and correct Dharma of all buddhas;
All buddhas, having performed buddha-works, all manifest entering nirvana.
These are the ten.
Buddha's disciple!
The buddhas, the world-honored ones, have ten kinds of skillful means.
What are the ten?
All buddhas understand that all dharmas are free from conceptual proliferation, yet they are able to reveal the buddhas' wholesome roots. This is the first skillful means.

All buddhas know that all dharmas are completely unseen, mutually unknown, unfettered and unliberated, without acceptance or accumulation, and without accomplishment. They are sovereign and ultimately reach the other shore, yet they truly know the dharmas without difference or distinction, and attain sovereignty. They are without self and without acceptance, yet without destroying the ultimate truth, they have already attained the stage of great sovereignty. They are always able to observe the entire dharma realm. This is the second skillful means.

All buddhas are forever free from all characteristics, their minds dwelling nowhere, yet they are able to know all without confusion or error. Although they know that all characteristics are by nature nonexistent, they are able to enter into their essential nature and also manifest immeasurable physical forms and all the pure buddha lands with their various adornments and inexhaustible characteristics, gathering the lamp of wisdom to extinguish the delusions of sentient beings. This is the third skillful means.

All buddhas abide in the Dharma realm, not dwelling in the past, future, or present, because in the nature of suchness there are no characteristics of the three times of past, future, and present. Yet they are able to expound the appearance of immeasurable buddhas in the past, future, and present worlds, causing those who hear to universally see all the buddha lands. This is the fourth skillful means.

The physical, verbal, and mental actions of all buddhas are uncreated, without coming or going, and also without abiding. They transcend all enumerated dharmas and reach the other shore of all dharmas. They are the treasury of the myriad dharmas, endowed with immeasurable wisdom, and thoroughly understand the various worldly and supramundane dharmas. Their wisdom is unobstructed, and they manifest immeasurable sovereign spiritual powers. They tame all sentient beings in the dharma realm. This is the fifth skillful means.

All buddhas know that all dharmas are invisible, neither one nor different, neither measurable nor immeasurable, neither coming nor going, and all have no intrinsic nature, yet they do not contradict the dharmas of the world.

The omniscient ones see all dharmas within the absence of intrinsic nature, are sovereign over the dharmas, extensively expound the dharmas, and always abide in the true reality. This is the sixth skillful means.

All buddhas at one time know all times, endowed with pure wholesome roots, entering the correct stage without attachment, not abiding in or abandoning such times as days, months, years, eons of formation and destruction, and so forth, yet able to manifest day and night, beginning, middle, and end, one day, seven days, half a month, one month, one year, one hundred years, one eon, many eons, inconceivable eons, inexpressible eons, up to eons at the end of the future, always turning the wonderful Dharma wheel for sentient beings, unceasing, unremitting, without rest, this is the seventh skillful means.

All buddhas always abide in the Dharma realm, accomplishing the buddhas' immeasurable fearlessness, innumerable eloquence, immeasurable eloquence, inexhaustible eloquence, uninterrupted eloquence, boundless eloquence, unequaled eloquence, endless eloquence, true eloquence, skillfully revealing the eloquence of all phrases, and the eloquence of all dharmas. Why is this?
Because the essence of all dharmas cannot be spoken.

All dharmas have no place, cannot be spoken of as collected, cannot be spoken of as scattered, cannot be spoken of as one, cannot be spoken of as many, their sounds cannot be reached, language is completely cut off. Although various verbal expressions follow worldly conventions, they have no objects to which they cling, no creations, and are far removed from all false thoughts and attachments. In this way, they ultimately reach the other shore.
This is the ninth skillful means.
